question_text:
Question 15. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MCQ (1M)
Question ID : 8232513102
Let H be a binary min-heap consisting of n elements implemented as an array. What is the worst
case time complexity of an optimal algorithm to find the maximum element in 
H
/?
(A) 
(log )
n

(B) 
(1)

(C) 
( log )
n
n

(D) 
( )
n

explanation_text:
Sol.
  
In a min heap maximum element is present at leaf node we need to navigate through the leaf node i.e.
n/2 node Hence O(n).
